class="line"><!---->[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<!----></span><br><br><div id="a"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;div id="a"&gt;<!----></span><br>  <div id="b"><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;div id="b"&gt;<!----></span><br>    <div id="inner"></div><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;div id="inner"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br>  </div><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br></div><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<span class="line"><!---->Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1462742<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1462742" title="SVG foreignObject is not respecting width and height dimensions"><!---->Fixed: 1462742<!----></a><br>Fixed: 1454351<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1454351" title="DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()"><!---->Fixed: 1454351<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I0ff0818ac85844acf5f6ec88ad73db83147ee01e<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);

  }

      text-align: left;

    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {

        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        }

          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                focus on the issue search field<span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    c<kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                compose a new issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                </span>
                show this help dialog<span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>

                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
            </div>

                  <!---->:

              <!---->

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<span class="line"><!---->While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br><br>AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<span class="line"><!---->AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1454351#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 8:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          (was: Security: Chrome crash leads to a 'Stack Overflow' as well as an 'Access Violation' bug)
          <br>
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Untriaged
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ----
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          ikilpatrick@chromium.org mstensho@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          (was: Security: Chrome crash leads to a 'Stack Overflow' as well as an 'Access Violation' bug)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Untriaged
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          ----
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          ikilpatrick@chromium.org mstensho@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        OK, since this doesn't appear to be a security bug, I'm taking this out of the security queue.<span class="line"><!---->OK, since this doesn't appear to be a security bug, I'm taking this out of the security queue.<!----></span><br><br>It does appear to be a bug that it's failing this DCHECK though. I'm going to leave this in the layout component and change this to a non-security bug. CCing the author and reviewer of <span class="line"><!---->It does appear to be a bug that it's failing this DCHECK though. I'm going to leave this in the layout component and change this to a non-security bug. CCing the author and reviewer of <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4456347<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4456347"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4456347<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which introduced this DCHECK.<span class="line"><!----> which introduced this DCHECK.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        As this report is being used for Check failure issue (or DCHECK), From my original report, I am confident that the test case reveals a security issue involving Stack Overflow in Arbitrary Addresses, resulting in an Access Violation. To address this matter and provide additional information, I have opened a separate report for discussion. In case the issue is not reproducible, I will be glad to provide further details. Thank you for your attention to this matter.<span class="line"><!---->As this report is being used for Check failure issue (or DCHECK), From my original report, I am confident that the test case reveals a security issue involving Stack Overflow in Arbitrary Addresses, resulting in an Access Violation. To address this matter and provide additional information, I have opened a separate report for discussion. In case the issue is not reproducible, I will be glad to provide further details. Thank you for your attention to this matter.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a><br>Author: Ian Kilpatrick <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ian Kilpatrick &lt;<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jul 08 00:22:20 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jul 08 00:22:20 2023<!----></span><br><br>[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<span class="line"><!---->[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<!----></span><br><br><div id="a"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;div id="a"&gt;<!----></span><br>  <div id="b"><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;div id="b"&gt;<!----></span><br>    <div id="inner"></div><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;div id="inner"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br>  </div><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br></div><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<span class="line"><!---->Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1462742<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1462742" title="SVG foreignObject is not respecting width and height dimensions"><!---->Fixed: 1462742<!----></a><br>Fixed: 1454351<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1454351" title="DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()"><!---->Fixed: 1454351<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I0ff0818ac85844acf5f6ec88ad73db83147ee01e<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352"><!---->51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<!----></a><br>Author: Ian Kilpatrick <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ian Kilpatrick &lt;<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Jul 10 04:27:42 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Jul 10 04:27:42 2023<!----></span><br><br>[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<span class="line"><!---->[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<!----></span><br><br><div id="a"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;div id="a"&gt;<!----></span><br>  <div id="b"><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;div id="b"&gt;<!----></span><br>    <div id="inner"></div><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;div id="inner"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br>  </div><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br></div><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<span class="line"><!---->Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1462742<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1462742" title="SVG foreignObject is not respecting width and height dimensions"><!---->Fixed: 1462742<!----></a><br>Fixed:         }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        @media (max-width: 840px) {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1454351: DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454351: DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<span class="line"><!---->While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br><br>AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<span class="line"><!---->AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed:             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<span class="line"><!---->While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br><br>AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<span class="line"><!---->AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        OK, since this doesn't appear to be a security bug, I'm taking this out of the security queue.<span class="line"><!---->OK, since this doesn't appear to be a security bug, I'm taking this out of the security queue.<!----></span><br><br>It does appear to be a bug that it's failing this DCHECK though. I'm going to leave this in the layout component and change this to a non-security bug. CCing the author and reviewer of <span class="line"><!---->It does appear to be a bug that it's failing this DCHECK though.         As this report is being used for Check failure issue (or DCHECK), From my original report, I am confident that the test case reveals a security issue involving Stack Overflow in Arbitrary Addresses, resulting in an Access Violation. To address this matter and provide additional information, I have opened a separate report for discussion. In case the issue is not reproducible, I will be glad to provide further details. Thank you for your attention to this matter.<span class="line"><!---->As this report is being used for Check failure issue (or DCHECK), From my original report, I am confident that the test case reveals a security issue involving Stack Overflow in Arbitrary Addresses, resulting in an Access Violation. To address this matter and provide additional information, I have opened a separate report for discussion. In case the issue is not reproducible, I will be glad to provide further details. Thank you for your attention to this matter.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a><br>Author: Ian Kilpatrick <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ian Kilpatrick &lt;<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jul 08 00:22:20 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jul 08 00:22:20 2023<!----></span><br><br>[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<span class="line"><!---->[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<!----></span><br><br><div id="a"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;div id="a"&gt;<!----></span><br>  <div id="b"><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;div id="b"&gt;<!----></span><br>    <div id="inner"></div><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;div id="inner"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br>  </div><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br></div><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<span class="line"><!---->Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1462742<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1462742" title="SVG foreignObject is not respecting width and height dimensions"><!---->Fixed: 1462742<!----></a><br>Fixed: 1454351<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1454351" title="DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()"><!---->Fixed: 1454351<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I0ff0818ac85844acf5f6ec88ad73db83147ee01e<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352"><!---->51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<!----></a><br>Author: Ian Kilpatrick <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ian Kilpatrick &lt;<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Jul 10 04:27:42 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Jul 10 04:27:42 2023<!----></span><br><br>[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<span class="line"><!---->[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<!----></span><br><br><div id="a"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;div id="a"&gt;<!----></span><br>  <div id="b"><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;div id="b"&gt;<!----></span><br>    <div id="inner"></div><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;div id="inner"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br>  </div><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br></div><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<span class="line"><!---->Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1462742<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1462742" title="SVG foreignObject is not respecting width and height dimensions"><!---->Fixed: 1462742<!----></a><br>Fixed:             Issue 1454351: DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454351: DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      fazim...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/584297913" title="fazim...@gmail.com"><!---->fazim...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      fazim...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->fazim...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 2:10 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 2:10 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 2:10 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454351: DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 2:10 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1454351: DCHECK_EQ(space.GetWritingMode(), StyleRef().GetWritingMode()) failing in LayoutBox::LayoutSubtreeRoot()
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<span class="line"><!---->While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br><br>AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<span class="line"><!---->AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2.
