Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<span class="line"><!---->While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br><br>AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<span class="line"><!---->AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a><br>Author: Ian Kilpatrick <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ian Kilpatrick &lt;<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jul 08 00:22:20 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jul 08 00:22:20 2023<!----></span><br><br>[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<span class="line"><!---->[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<!----></span><br><br><div id="a"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;div id="a"&gt;<!----></span><br>  <div id="b"><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;div id="b"&gt;<!----></span><br>    <div id="inner"></div><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;div id="inner"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br>  </div><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br></div><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<span class="line"><!---->Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1462742<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1462742" title="SVG foreignObject is not respecting width and height dimensions"><!---->Fixed:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!----> <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352"><!---->51f9bcde764d315ffc19858d701c8027ffff7352<!----></a><br>Author: Ian Kilpatrick <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ian Kilpatrick &lt;<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Jul 10 04:27:42 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Jul 10 04:27:42 2023<!----></span><br><br>[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<span class="line"><!---->[layout] Fix relayout boundary logic.<!----></span><br><br><div id="a"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;div id="a"&gt;<!----></span><br>  <div id="b"><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;div id="b"&gt;<!----></span><br>    <div id="inner"></div><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;div id="inner"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br>  </div><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br></div><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/div&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<span class="line"><!---->Where "a" and "b" are potential relayout boundary targets.<!----></span><br><br>Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<span class="line"><!---->Previously it was possible to have the following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<span class="line"><!---->3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436"><!---->d5a08f0a0db3861630f7a082075d5647a41f8436<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Fixed: 1462742<a       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<span class="line"><!---->While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br><br>AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<span class="line"><!---->AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The original report appears to just be a stack overflow, which I don't think is exploitable.<span class="line"><!---->The original report appears to just be a stack overflow, which I don't think is exploitable.<!----></span><br><br>However, I notice that this is tripping a DCHECK [1]:<span class="line"><!---->However, I notice that this is tripping a DCHECK [1]:<!----></span><br><br>[3621180:1:0613/145417.678225:FATAL:layout_box.cc(948)] Check failed: space.GetWritingMode() == StyleRef().GetWritingMode() (vertical-rl vs. horizontal-tb)<span class="line"><!---->[3621180:1:0613/145417.678225:FATAL:layout_box.cc(948)] Check failed: space.GetWritingMode() == StyleRef().GetWritingMode() (vertical-rl vs. horizontal-tb)<!----></span><br><br>ikilpatrick, are there any security implications to failing this DCHECK?<span class="line"><!---->ikilpatrick, are there any security implications to failing this DCHECK?<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/layout_box.cc;l=948;drc=8ba54e6b47081af7ebd45fdb66aaf6b3471d451d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/layout_box.cc;l=948;drc=8ba54e6b47081af7ebd45fdb66aaf6b3471d451d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/layout_box.cc;l=948;drc=8ba54e6b47081af7ebd45fdb66aaf6b3471d451d<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<span class="line"><!---->While fuzzing, I encountered a crash with a stack overflow. I have provided the original test case `testcase.html`, which shows an ASAN trace stating 'stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede' and causes a crash with STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION. Additionally, I have also extracted the code snippets that cause the crash `poc.html`, but they do not provide any ASAN logs based on my testing. These snippets result in a Chrome crash with STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: asan-win32-release_x64-1153002 + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 22H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<span class="line"><!---->.\asan-win32-release_x64-1153002\chrome --no-sandbox G:\poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br><br>AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<span class="line"><!---->AddressSanitizer: stack-overflow on address 0x7ff66e2c0ede (pc 0x7ff66e2c0ede bp 0x00ce4a403be0 sp 0x00ce4a403b60 T0)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

following invalidation logic:<!----></span><br>1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<span class="line"><!---->1. "inner" changes - and invalidates layout up to "b".<!----></span><br>2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<span class="line"><!---->2. "b" gets added as a relayout boundary.<!----></span><br>3. "b" changes its *own* style - and invalidates layout up to "a".<!----></span><br>   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<span class="line"><!---->   (note this may disqualify "b" as a relayout boundary).<!----></span><br>4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<span class="line"><!---->4. Layout starts at "b" but potentially with the wrong constraints.<!----></span><br>5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<span class="line"><!---->5. Layout starts at "a", but doesn't revisit "b" as it is layout clean.<!----></span><br><br>This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<span class="line"><!---->This caused various types of DCHECKs and potentially incorrect layouts.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we don't relayout as a root if we are marked as<!----></span><br>needing layout by our *own* style.<span class="line"><!---->needing layout by our *own* style.<!----></span><br><br>Fixed:            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

});

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
